body.p: To the Hon B. Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Your petitioners would respectfully state that at the March term 1861 of the Carroll Circuit Court John Montogmery was fined $20 for Gaming --

We state that the indictment was procurred through Malice. That Montgomery is not a Gambler nor in the habit of playing for amusement. Believing that the Criminal Law should not be used for the purpose of gratifying private malice We respectfully request your excellency to remit said fine

Petitioners
W M Fishers
M T Pryer
A. J. Gurtune
S O"Neal
R. J. Wilson
H W Pryor
A F Tunagan
Petitioners
H Harris
F M Giel
T W Minish
M. W. Dillehunt
David Hogan
M T. Milner
The Subscribers to the foregoing petition are citizens of Carroll County, and reliable men & their signatures genuine
Given under my hand this 22 May 1861
John Hogan C. C. C. C

Carroll Cir. Ct
$20. } Gaming
Jno. Montgomery
Respt 12 Mos
Issd May 24. 1861
